clinical_study.brief_title: Nivolumab in Association With Radiotherapy and Cisplatin in Locally Advanced Cervical Cancers Followed by Adjuvant Nivolumab for up to 6 Months
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase-I Study of Nivolumab in Association With Radiotherapy and Cisplatin in Locally Advanced Cervical Cancers Followed by Adjuvant Nivolumab for up to 6 Months. NiCOL

brief_summary.textblock: To date, the majority of clinical trials on checkpoint inhibitors have tested these agents as monotherapy, and the next logical step is to evaluate rational therapeutic associations. The aim of the NiCOL study is to assess the safety of nivolumab in association with chemoradiation therapy and to gain initial insight into its efficacy in association with the current standard of care, including chemoradiation.

primary_outcome.measure: rate of occurrence of dose-limiting toxicity (DLT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 11 weeks after the initiation of treatment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: after the end of RT and before brachytherapy and again up to 2 months after brachytherapy
secondary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the proportion of all subjects whose best response is either a complete response or a partial response.
PFS is defined as the length of time from the start of treatment to disease progression or death, regardless of the cause of death
DFS is defined as the length of time from the start of complete response to the time of relapse from complete response. DFS applies only to patients in complete response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) to assess the overall safety profile of the association of nivolumab and pelvic radio-chemotherapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the first intake of the IMP until 100 days after the last intake of the IMP

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Adverse Events (AEs) to assess the overall safety profile of the association of nivolumab and pelvic radio-chemotherapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the first intake of the IMP until 100 days after the last intake of the IMP

secondary_outcome.measure: validation of molecular alterations detected by molecular analyses
secondary_outcome.description: Retrospective exome, RNA and targeted sequencing analyses will be performed on all patients treated and for whom tumor samples are available.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, at Weeks 3, 6 and 12 and every 12 weeks up to Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Retrospective exome and targeted sequencing analyses will be performed on all patients treated and for whom tissue samples are available at the different timepoints
phenotypic analysis of the different components of the tumor microenvironment using various technologies

arm_group.description: 5 weeks of radiochemotherapy + nivolumab followed by 5 months of nivolumab alone

intervention.description: 2 possible doses : flat dose 240 mg q2 weeks or 1mg/kg q2 weeks
40 mg/m2, once a week during radiotherapy

Intensity-modulated radiation therapy (including volumetric-modulated arc therapy and tomography) will be used. A dose of 45 Gy will be delivered to the pelvis in 25 fractions of 1.8 Gy using a 6-MV photon energy. An additional dose of 54 Gy in 25 fractions of 2.16 Gy may be delivered to invaded lymph nodes using SIB-IMRT. An additional lateral pelvic dose may be delivered if coverage of the target volumes is judged insufficient. The volumes, doses and techniques will be those usually used in each center.
